Wi-Fi is goo for a distance of about 20 meters (66 feet) indoors due to walls and otehr interference and can have a greater range outdoors. Hotspot coverages can be as small as a single room with walls that block radio waves, or can be as large as many square kilometres being achieved by using multiple overlapping access points in the network.

The main difference is that there is absolutely no connection between them. WAN (Wide Area Network) refers to a large network, Usually the Internet. WiFi is simply a method of connecting to a router without using wires (the alternate called, Ethernet) The router, or more correctly the Modem, connects to the internet. WiFi connects to the router, not the WAN or internet, although many seem to think it does..

WiFi is a local connection type, as ethernet, phone cables are, albeit without the physical cables. WAN on the other hand stands for ‘Wide Area Network’; and is often employed through the internet to interconnect various ‘local’ networks such that they can be interconnected. The two are completely different tech, one is a local physical connection type, the other is a remote logical connection type.
